posts.post_content:
Hm... [Freed from the Real](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Freed from the Real) [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) [Darksteel Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Forge)  
  
The creature isn't sacrificed, it's *destroyed* when she untaps. Thus, the Forge means you get to keep it indefinitely, as well as every other creature you steal! Completely useless in anything other than casual play, but....  
  
brb making an EDH deck. Need help finding the pieces of the combo? [Fabricate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fabricate) [Enlightened Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enlightened Tutor) ANY BLACK TUTOR, it's like her colors were MADE for tutoring. Sounds like evil, evil fun! And the best part of that combo? Once you have it off and all your permanents are indestructible... [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) [Nevinyrral's Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nevinyrral's Disk) [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation). It's like this deck almost builds itself!
posts.html:
Hm... Freed from the Real Mycosynth Lattice Darksteel Forge

The creature isn't sacrificed, it's destroyed when she untaps. Thus, the Forge means you get to keep it indefinitely, as well as every other creature you steal! Completely useless in anything other than casual play, but....

brb making an EDH deck. Need help finding the pieces of the combo? Fabricate Enlightened Tutor ANY BLACK TUTOR, it's like her colors were MADE for tutoring. Sounds like evil, evil fun! And the best part of that combo? Once you have it off and all your permanents are indestructible... Wrath of God Day of Judgment Nevinyrral's Disk Damnation. It's like this deck almost builds itself!

I have plenty of thieving spells ([Puca's Mischief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puca's Mischief) would do it), and I can use Zur to find that [Freed from the Real](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Freed from the Real), [Pemmin's Aura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pemmin's Aura) or [Intruder Alarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intruder Alarm) to untap her. Nothing like screwing over a friend's control deck by turning his own general against him.

posts.post_content:
[Unbender Tine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unbender Tine), [Pemmin's Aura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pemmin's Aura), [Thousand-Year Elixir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thousand-Year Elixir), [Crab Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crab Umbra), [Freed From The Real](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Freed From The Real).  
  
You're welcome. Remember, untapping causes the creature you stole with her to be destroyed. If you stole an indestructible creature, it won't be destroyed and you keep control of it until she leaves the battlefield.

posts.post_content: [Ghostly Flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostly Flicker) was like invented for this card. You tap Merieke Ri Berit to gain control of some thing. Play [Ghostly Flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostly Flicker) targeting her and the creature you controlled. You get both back under your control untapped. Your Merieke ready to steal another creature at will.

Posted By: ToastedAmphibian (12/4/2011 7:23:09 PM)

posts.post_content:
Uhh... I think most people tend to forget, she has a "give the creature back" clause... all you have to do is steal her yourself. Sure, not always easy or effective; but this does set up a few interesting interactions.  
  
A, you steal an indestructible creature. Clearly, she can untap, and "destroy" it. But, you still only control it under the condition that you control Merieke, so if someone bounces her, you get your guy back.  
  
B, the exact opposite, assumes you're stealing an average creature, perhaps with the intention of killing it or some such. So you tap, gain control of it. They use Grab The Reins on her, and you find yourself unable to respond for some raisin; they get her and their dude back. Well, turn passes, you get your Merieke back, tapped, but you decide to untap her to steal something else... and the guy you don't even have control of suddenly dies, because the delayed trigger she creates doesn't seem to be contingent on if you control the creature or not, only that you t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

B, the exact opposite, assumes you're stealing an average creature, perhaps with the intention of killing it or some such. So you tap, gain control of it. They use Grab The Reins on her, and you find yourself unable to respond for some raisin; they get her and their dude back. Well, turn passes, you get your Merieke back, tapped, but you decide to untap her to steal something else... and the guy you don't even have control of suddenly dies, because the delayed trigger she creates doesn't seem to be contingent on if you control the creature or not, only that you t...
